htmlEmbed:
Jill Biden positive for COVID, President Biden tests negative, White House says@Reuters9/5/2023

U.S. first lady Jill Biden has tested positive for COVID-19 just days before President Joe Biden, who tested negative for the virus, is due to travel to a Group of 20 summit in India, the White House said on Monday.

NRLIN:OCOV, COVID, GEN, HEA, HUMDIS, INFDIS, NEWS1, POL, POTUS, WASH, AMERS, US, NAMER, RULES:BIDEN, TOPNWS, G20, INTAG, SASIA, IN, ASXPAC, EMRG, ASIA, LEGAL, REUTERS-LEGALRead

class="text__text__1FZLe text__dark-grey__3Ml43 text__regular__2N1Xr text__small__1kGq2 body__full_width__ekUdw body__small_body__2vQyf article-body__paragraph__2-BtD">WASHINGTON, Sept 4 (Reuters) - U.S. first lady Jill Biden has tested positive for COVID-19 just days before President Joe Biden, who tested negative for the virus, is due to travel to a Group of 20 summit in India, the White House said on Monday.</div><div data-testid="paragraph-1" class="text__text__1FZLe text__dark-grey__3Ml43 text__regular__2N1Xr text__small__1kGq2 body__full_width__ekUdw body__small_body__2vQyf article-body__paragraph__2-BtD">Biden's 72-year-old wife, whose symptoms were described as mild, last had COVID in August of last year. The president, now 80, last tested positive in July 2022.</div><div data-testid="paragraph-2" class="text__text__1FZLe text__dark-grey__3Ml43 text__regular__2N1Xr text__small__1kGq2 body__full_width__ekUdw body__small_body__2vQyf article-body__paragraph__2-BtD">"This evening, the First Lady tested positive for COVID-19," her communications director, Elizabeth Alexander, said in a statement. "She will remain at their home in Rehoboth Beach, Delaware."</div><div class="article-body__element__2p5pI"></div><div data-testid="paragraph-3" class="text__text__1FZLe text__dark-grey__3Ml43 text__regular__2N1Xr text__small__1kGq2 body__full_width__ekUdw body__small_body__2vQyf article-body__paragraph__2-BtD">Biden flew back alone from Delaware on Monday evening.</div><div data-testid="paragraph-4" class="text__text__1FZLe text__dark-grey__3Ml43 text__regular__2N1Xr text__small__1kGq2 body__full_width__ekUdw body__small_body__2vQyf article-body__paragraph__2-BtD">"Following the First Lady’s positive test for COVID-19, President Biden was administered a COVID test this evening," the White House said. "The President tested negative. The President will test at a regular cadence this week and monitor for symptoms."</div><div class="article-body__element__2p5pI" data-testid="gallery-0"><div class="" travel to a Group of 20 summit in India, the White House said on Monday."},{"type":"paragraph","content":"Biden's 72-year-old wife, whose symptoms were described as mild, last had COVID in August of last year. The president, now 80, last tested positive in July 2022."},{"type":"paragraph","content":"\"This evening, the First Lady tested positive for COVID-19,\" her communications director, Elizabeth Alexander, said in a statement. \"She will remain at their home in Rehoboth Beach, Delaware.\""},{"type":"paragraph","content":"Biden flew back alone from Delaware on Monday evening."},{"type":"paragraph","content":"\"Following the First Lady’s positive test for COVID-19, President Biden was administered a COVID test this evening,\" the White House said. \"The President tested negative. The President will test at a regular cadence this week and monitor for symptoms.\""},{"type":"paragraph","content":"The White House did not immediately respond to a request for comment on whether Biden’s foreign travel could be affected."},{"type":"paragraph","content":"But Biden's official week-ahead schedule, released shortly after the announcement of the first lady's diagnosis, showed him traveling to New Delhi on Thursday to attend the G20 summit. Biden is scheduled to fly to Hanoi on Sunday."},{"type":"paragraph","content":"Biden is running for re-election in 2024 in a campaign in which the question about his age has loomed as a key issue for voters."},{"type":"paragraph","content":"He is the oldest president to seek a second term, and some Republicans have said he is too old to be given another four years in the White House."},{"type":"paragraph","content":"Biden's allies say he remains fit to serve as president."}],"description":"U.S. first lady Jill Biden has tested positive for COVID-19 just days before readabilityObject.title: Jill Biden positive for COVID, President Biden tests negative, White House says
readabilityObject.content:
WASHINGTON, Sept 4 (Reuters) - U.S. first lady Jill Biden has tested positive for COVID-19 just days before President Joe Biden, who tested negative for the virus, is due to travel to a Group of 20 summit in India, the White House said on Monday.

Biden's 72-year-old wife, whose symptoms were described as mild, last had COVID in August of last year. The president, now 80, last tested positive in July 2022.

"This evening, the First Lady tested positive for COVID-19," her communications director, Elizabeth Alexander, said in a statement. "She will remain at their home in Rehoboth Beach, Delaware."

Biden flew back alone from Delaware on Monday evening.

"Following the First Lady’s positive test for COVID-19, President Biden was administered a COVID test this evening," the White House said. "The President tested negative. The President will test at a regular cadence this week and monitor for symptoms."

Item 1 of 4 U.S. President Joe Biden and first lady Jill Biden walk to Marine One on the South Lawn of the White House in Washington, U.S., September 2, 2023. REUTERS/Ken Cedeno/File Photo

[1/4]U.S. President Joe Biden and first lady Jill Biden walk to Marine One on the South Lawn of the White House in Washington, U.S., September 2, 2023. REUTERS/Ken Cedeno/File Photo Purchase Licensing Rights, opens new tab

The White House did not immediately respond to a request for comment on whether Biden’s foreign travel could be affected.

But Biden's official week-ahead schedule, released shortly after the announcement of the first lady's diagnosis, showed him traveling to New Delhi on Thursday to attend the G20 summit. Biden is scheduled to fly to Hanoi on Sunday.

Biden is running for re-election in 2024 in a campaign in which the question about his age has loomed as a key issue for voters.

He is the oldest president to seek a second term, and some Republicans have said he is too old to be given another four years in the White House.

Biden's allies say he remains fit to serve as president.

Sign up here.

Reporting by Ismail Shakil, Matt Spetalnick and Trevor Hunnicutt; Editing by Muralikumar Anantharaman and Gerry Doyle

Our Standards: The Thomson Reuters Trust Principles., opens new tab

video.name: Biden still negative for COVID -White House
video.description: U.S. President Joe Biden tested negative for COVID-19 again on Tuesday, the White House said, while First Lady Jill Biden continues to experience mild symptoms after testing positive for the virus.
